channel.title: auditd on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in auditd on My New Hugo Site

item.title: CVE-2021-4034 Exploitation Attempt
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of vulnerability described in CVE-2021-4034.

item.title: Disable System Firewall
item.description: Detects disabling of system firewalls which could be used by adversaries to bypass controls that limit usage of the network.

item.title: Linux Capabilities Discovery
item.description: Detects attempts to discover the files with setuid/setgid capabilitiy on them. That would allow adversary to escalate their privileges.

item.title: Data Exfiltration with Wget
item.description: Detects attempts to post the file with the usage of wget utility. The adversary can bypass the permission restriction with the misconfigured sudo permission for wget utility which could allow them to read files like /etc/shadow.

item.title: Clipboard Collection with Xclip Tool
item.description: Detects attempts to collect data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool. Xclip has to be installed. Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of clipboard utilities on user workstations.

item.title: Screen Capture with Import Tool
item.description: Detects adversary creating screen capture of a desktop with Import Tool. Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of screenshot utilities on user workstations. ImageMagick must be installed.

item.title: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteShellCommand
item.description: Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider Invoke_ExecuteShellCommand to execute any UNIX/Linux command using the /bin/sh shell. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including Microsoft Operations Manager. Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

item.title: Screen Capture with Xwd
item.description: Detects adversary creating screen capture of a full with xwd. Highly recommended using rule on servers, due high usage of screenshot utilities on user workstations

item.title: Steganography Extract Files with Steghide
item.description: Detects extraction of files with usage of steghide binary, the adversaries may use this technique to prevent the detection of hidden information.

item.title: Steganography Hide Files with Steghide
item.description: Detects embeding of files with usage of steghide binary, the adversaries may use this technique to prevent the detection of hidden information.

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Masquerading as Linux Crond Process
item.description: Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an executable, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation. Several different variations of this technique have been observed.

item.title: Modification of ld.so.preload
item.description: Identifies modification of ld.so.preload for shared object injection. This technique is used by attackers to load arbitrary code into processes.

item.title: System Owner or User Discovery
item.description: Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.

item.title: Auditing Configuration Changes on Linux Host
item.description: Detect changes in auditd configuration files

item.title: Logging Configuration Changes on Linux Host
item.description: Detect changes of syslog daemons configuration files

item.title: File or Folder Permissions Change
item.description: Detects file and folder permission changes.

item.title: Remove Immutable File Attribute
item.description: Detects removing immutable file attribute.

item.title: Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null
item.description: Detects overwriting (effectively wiping/deleting) of a file.

item.title: Systemd Service Reload or Start
item.description: Detects a reload or a start of a service.

item.title: Data Compressed
item.description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

item.title: Webshell Remote Command Execution
item.description: Detects possible command execution by web application/web shell

item.title: Edit of .bash_profile and .bashrc
item.description: Detects change of user environment. Adversaries can insert code into these files to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell.

item.title: Program Executions in Suspicious Folders
item.description: Detects program executions in suspicious non-program folders related to malware or hacking activity

item.title: Suspicious Commands Linux
item.description: Detects relevant commands often related to malware or hacking activity

item.title: Audio Capture
item.description: Detects attempts to record audio with arecord utility

item.title: Binary Padding
item.description: Adversaries may use binary padding to add junk data and change the on-disk representation of malware. This rule detect using dd and truncate to add a junk data to file.

item.title: Clipboard Collection of Image Data with Xclip Tool
item.description: Detects attempts to collect image data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool. Xclip has to be installed. Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of clipboard utilities on user workstations.

item.title: Creation Of An User Account
item.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

item.title: Credentials In Files
item.description: Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep

item.title: CVE-2021-3156 Exploitation Attempt
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of vulnerability described in CVE-2021-3156. | Alternative approach might be to look for flooding of auditd logs due to bruteforcing | required to trigger the heap-based buffer overflow.

item.title: File Time Attribute Change
item.description: Detect file time attribute change to hide new or changes to existing files.

item.title: Loading of Kernel Module via Insmod
item.description: Detects loading of kernel modules with insmod command. Loadable Kernel Modules (LKMs) are pieces of code that can be loaded and unloaded into the kernel upon demand. Adversaries may use LKMs to obtain persistence within the system or elevate the privileges.

item.title: Password Policy Discovery
item.description: Detects password policy discovery commands

item.title: Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
item.description: Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners

item.title: Split A File Into Pieces
item.description: Detection use of the command “split” to split files into parts and possible transfer.

item.title: Steganography Hide Zip Information in Picture File
item.description: Detects appending of zip file to image

item.title: Steganography Unzip Hidden Information From Picture File
item.description: Detects extracting of zip file from image file

item.title: Suspicious C2 Activities
item.description: Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its ‘Best Practice Auditd Configuration’. This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap. These commands match a few techniques from the tactics “Command and Control”, including not exhaustively the following; Application Layer Protocol (T1071), Non-Application Layer Protocol (T1095), Data Encoding (T1132)

item.title: Suspicious History File Operations
item.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

item.title: System Information Discovery
item.description: Detects System Information Discovery commands

item.title: System Shutdown/Reboot
item.description: Adversaries may shutdown/reboot systems to interrupt access to, or aid in the destruction of, those systems.

item.title: Systemd Service Creation
item.description: Detects a creation of systemd services which could be used by adversaries to execute malicious code.
